intro: Hunteria africana, commonly known as the African moonflower, is a climbing plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its showy, fragrant white flowers that open at night. The plant has thick, fleshy stems and leaves that are usually opposite and ovate. Its flowers have five petals and are often accompanied by bright yellow stamens. Hunteria africana is adapted to arid environments and is often found in rocky areas or along riverbanks.
